page.title: 05RIPPONDEN BANK
page.content: Ripponden Bank is part of Ripponden Village. It is 3 miles west of Stainland. The village is situated in the bottom of a steep sided valley. There is a river running through the middle of the village called the Ryburn. There are two bridges crossing the river. One is old, cobbled, and narrow, and was built for horse drawn traffic. The other one is wider, covered with tarmac, and is used for motor vehicles. By the side of the river is St. Bartholomew's Church. There have been four churches on this site, the present one was built in 1867. Near the church is a community centre which is used for Cubs, Scouts, Brownies, Baby Clinic, Toddlers' Club, Play School, Jumble Sales and Sunday School.
